data.author: Chris Lewis

changelog.release_notes:
v4.3:
- Roll back use of huge libraries, but keep new UX features.

v4.2:
- Improved UX (repeat clicks, text alignment)
- Uses pebble-events, pebble-packet
- Better retry mechanisms

v4.0:
- Build with SDK 4 for Diorite.
- Now shows most recently downloaded headline in the app launcher in FW 4.0.

v3.8:
- Layout changes to get another line or two into the title view. 
- Increase buffers to support new longer story titles.

v3.7:
- Fix issue with <![CDATA[]]> tags appearing in news items.

v3.6:
- Add News Region selection per BBC News feed availability
- Fixed truncated caching warning
- Add PayPal donation link (experimental)
- Other minor layout and code improvements

v3.5:
- Unified card design for Aplite (3.8), Basalt, and Chalk.
- Timeline pins now available for Aplite (3.8) watches.
- Minor UX bug fixes.

v3.4:
- Numerous minor UI improvements
- Coloring to extend thumbnail base color
- Moved attribution to Settings window
- Removed buggy 'pins with notifications' option.

v3.2:
- Polish layout and UX.
- Fix strange behaviors.
- New splash screen to match my other major apps.

v3.0:
- Added new design for Pebble Time Round.

v1.8:
- Numerous layout improvements (category view, animations, hints etc)
- Color images for Basalt users!
- Other bug fixes.

v1.7:
- Improved update reliability
- Fixed rare layout bugs

v1.6:
- Fix a couple layout & scrolling bugs
- Basalt users can now get timeline notifications when a new news story is created.

1.5:
- Revamped design, using animated cards.
- Persistent storage of last stories
- Timeline integration
- On-watch configuration, replacing the config page.

v1.3.0:
- Added option between font size 18 and 24 in story detail view.

v1.2.0:
- Switched to faster streaming paradigm
- Added version checking and latest news

data.description:
Read the top 10 - 20 BBC News stories on your wrist. Categories available: Headlines, World, UK, Politics, Science & Environment, Technology, Health, Education, Entertainment & Arts.

Now includes regions around the world!

Category, number of stories, font size is configurable from within the app. 

Note: This app is not an official BBC News app, but a novel use of its public feeds.

latest_release.release_notes:
v4.3:
- Roll back use of huge libraries, but keep new UX features.

data.title: News Headlines
